              def index

                scope = if params[:user_id]

              2

              5
            

            

                elsif params[:target_user_id]
          
      10.

            module UserRelationship

              extend ActiveSupport::Concern

              included do

              1
            

            

                has_many :following, -> { order(follows: { id: :desc }) }, through: :active_relationships,  source: :target_user

              def data

            class UserFeed

              def feed(offset = 0, limit = -1)
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            
              5
            

            

                end_idx = limit < 0 ? limit : offset+limit-1
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            
              5
            

            

                members = REDIS.call("ZRANGE", feed_key, offset, end_idx, "REV")
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
              11
            

            

                members.map { |m| parse_member(m) }
          
      22.

    23. 
            

            

            
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            
              1
            

            

              def count
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
              2
            

            

                REDIS.call("ZCARD", feed_key).to_i
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            

            

              end
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            

            

            
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
              1
            

            

              def add_to_feed(sleep_log)
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
              1
            

            

                REDIS.call("ZADD", feed_key, score(sleep_log), member_key(sleep_log))
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            

            

              end
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            

            

            
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
              1
            

            

              def remove_from_feed(members)
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            
              4
            

            

                member_keys = members.map { |m| member_key(m) }
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
              2
            

            

                return if member_keys.blank?
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            

            

            
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            
              1
            

            

                REDIS.call("ZREM", feed_key, member_keys)
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            

            

              end
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            

            

            
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            
              1
            

            

              def resize_feed
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            
              3
            

            

                members_count = count
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            
              3
            

            

                return if members_count <= UserFeed::MAXIMUM_FEED
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            

            

            
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            
              1
            

            

                Rails.logger.info(message: "resize feed user", user_id: @user.id, count: members_count)
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            
              1
            

            

                REDIS.call("ZREMRANGEBYRANK", feed_key, 0, members_count-UserFeed::MAXIMUM_FEED-1)
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            

            

              end
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            

            

            
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            
              1
            

            

              private
          
      48.

      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            
              17
            

            

                    overlapped ||= SleepLog.where("user_id = ? AND clock_in >= ? AND clock_in <= ?", @user.id, @clock_in, @clock_out).exists? if @clock_out
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
              17
            

            

                    raise SleepLogService::Error.new("Clock in time is overlapped with existing sleep log") if overlapped
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            

            

            
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
              9
            

            

                    log.user = @user
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            
              9
            

            

                    log.clock_in =  @clock_in
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
              9
            

            

                    log.clock_out = @clock_out if @clock_out.present?
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
              9
            

            

                    log.save!
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27.

                    log

                def validate!

                  now = now_with_buffer

                  raise SleepLogService::Error.new("Clock in must be lower than #{now}") if @clock_in > now

                }

            RSpec.describe UserFeed, type: :model do
          
      4. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    4. 
            

            

              # Use `let!` to ensure the user object is created for each example.
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            
              19
            

            

              let!(:user) { create(:user, id: 123) }
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            

            

              # Instantiate the UserFeed object for each test.
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            
              19
            

            

              let(:user_feed) { UserFeed.new(user) }
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            

            

            
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            

            

              # Mock the global REDIS constant. This is crucial to avoid actual Redis calls.
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            

            

              # We use `allow(REDIS).to receive(:call)` to mock specific Redis commands.
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            
              1
            

            

              before do
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            
              18
            

            

                allow(REDIS).to receive(:call) # Allow all calls to REDIS.call by default
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            

            

              end
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14.

              # Helper for creating a mock sleep log with necessary attributes.

    16. 
            

            

              # This avoids creating actual database records for SleepLog.
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            
              1
            

            

              def mock_sleep_log(id, user_id, clock_in, sleep_duration)
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            
              3
            

            

                instance_double("SleepLog",
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            

            

                                id: id,
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            

            

                                user_id: user_id,
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            

            

                                clock_in: clock_in,
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            

            

                                sleep_duration: sleep_duration)
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            

            

              end
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            

            

            
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
              1
            

            

              describe '#initialize' do
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
              1
            

            

                it 'sets the user instance variable' do
          
      27.

              1
            

            

                  expect(user_feed.instance_variable_get(:@user)).to eq(user)
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            

            

                end
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29.

      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
              1
            

            

              describe '#feed' do

    32. 
            
              6
            

            

                let(:feed_key) { "feed:#{user.id}" }
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            
              6
            

            

                let(:clock_in_time_1) { Time.zone.parse("2024-06-25 10:00:00 UTC") }
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
              6
            

            

                let(:clock_in_time_2) { Time.zone.parse("2024-06-25 09:00:00 UTC") }
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            

            

            
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            

            

                # Sample JSON strings representing members in Redis.
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            
              6
            

            

                let(:redis_member_json_1) { { uid: 456, id: 1, ts: clock_in_time_1.strftime("%Y%m%dT%H%M%S%z") }.to_json }
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            
              6
            

            

                let(:redis_member_json_2) { { uid: 789, id: 2, ts: clock_in_time_2.strftime("%Y%m%dT%H%M%S%z") }.to_json }
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39.

              1

                describe '#parse_member' do

                describe '#score' do
          
      210. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    210. 
            
              2
            

            

                  let(:sleep_log) { mock_sleep_log(1, 1, Time.current, 7.hours.to_i) } # 7 hours duration

                  it 'returns the sleep_duration of the sleep_log' do

                    expect(user_feed.send(:score, sleep_log)).to eq(7.hours.to_i)
          
      214. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    214. 
            

            

                  end
          
      215.

                end
          
      216.

      217. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    217. 
            
              1
            

            

                describe '#member_key' do
          
      218.

                  it "returns a successful response with the updated sleep log" do

    142. 
            
              1
            

            

                    expect(response).to be_successful
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            
              1
            

            

                    expect(response).to have_http_status(:ok)
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            
              1
            

            

                    expect(response).to match_response_schema("sleep_log")
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            
              1
            

            

                    expect(json_response['data']['id']).to eq(sleep_log_to_clock_out.id)

                  end

                  before do

                  it "returns an unauthorized status" do

    159. 
            

            

                  end

                  it "returns a list of users the user is following" do

      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            

            

                  end
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172.

            RSpec.describe FollowService::Unfollow, type: :service do

            require 'rails_helper'

            RSpec.describe LeaderboardService::BackfillFeedByFollowing, type: :service do
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            
              14
            

            

              let!(:user) { create(:user, last_backfill_at: nil) } # User performing the backfill
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            
              14
            

            

              let!(:followed_user_1) { create(:user) }
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            
              14
            

            

              let!(:followed_user_2) { create(:user) }
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            

            

            
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            

            

              # Create follow relationships for the 'user'
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            
              14
            

            

              let!(:follow_1) { create(:follow, user: user, target_user: followed_user_1, id: 1) }

    11. 
            
              14
            

            

              let!(:follow_2) { create(:follow, user: user, target_user: followed_user_2, id: 2) }
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            

            

            
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            

            

              # Instantiate the service object
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
              14
            

            

              let(:service) { described_class.new(user) }
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            

            

            
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            

            

              # A fixed "current" time for consistent testing.
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            
              14
            

            

              let(:frozen_time) { Time.zone.parse("2024-06-25 10:00:00 UTC") }
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            

            

            
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            
              1
            

            

              before do
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            

            

                # Freeze time for consistent test results, especially for `Time.now.utc` and `6.hour.ago.utc`.
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
              13
            

            

                Timecop.freeze(frozen_time)
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            

            

            
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            

            

                # Stub `Racecar` methods to prevent actual Kafka calls.
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            
              13
            

            

                allow(Racecar).to receive(:produce_async)
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            

            

                # The `wait_for_delivery` method takes a block. Simulate calling that block.
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
              13
            

            

                allow(Racecar).to receive(:wait_for_delivery).and_yield
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            

            

              end
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            

            

            
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
              1
            

            

              after do
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
              13
            

            

                Timecop.return # Unfreeze time after each test.
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            

            

              end
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            

            

            
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            
              1
            

            

              describe '#perform' do
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
              1
            

            

                context 'when the user has not been recently backfilled' do
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
              1
            

            

                  before do
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            

            

                    # Ensure `last_backfill_at` is nil or older than 6 hours for this context.
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            
              8
            

            

                    user.update_column(:last_backfill_at, frozen_time - 7.hours) # Or nil, as per initial `let!`

            RSpec.describe LeaderboardService::BackfillFeedByUser, type: :service do
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            
              11
            

            

              let!(:user) { create(:user) }
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            
              11
            

            

              let!(:followed_user) { create(:user) }
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            
              11
            

            

              let(:frozen_time) { Time.zone.parse("2024-06-25 10:00:00 UTC") }
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            

            

            
          
      9.

              # Instantiate the service object.

    13. 
            
              11

      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            

            

            
          
      15.

      18.

                # Mock the `UserFeed.new` call to return our controlled mock object.

                allow(user_feed_mock).to receive(:add_to_feed) # Stub this method, we'll verify it's called.
          
      21.

      22.

                allow(Follow).to receive(:find_by).with(user_id: user.id, target_user_id: followed_user.id).and_return(instance_double(Follow))
          
      27.

      28.

                # Mock the ActiveRecord Relation for followed_user.sleep_logs for `find_in_batches`.
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            

            

                # This is crucial for controlling what logs are "found" and yielded.
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            

            

                # We create a mock relation that responds to `where`, `order`, and `find_in_batches`.
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
              10
            

            

                sleep_logs_relation_mock = instance_double(ActiveRecord::Relation)
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
              10
            

            

                allow(followed_user).to receive(:sleep_logs).and_return(sleep_logs_relation_mock)
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            

            

            
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            

            

                # Chain the `where` and `order` calls, making them return the same mock relation.
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
              10
            

            

                allow(sleep_logs_relation_mock).to receive(:where).with("clock_in > ?", leaderboard_threshold_time).and_return(sleep_logs_relation_mock)
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            
              10
            

            

                allow(sleep_logs_relation_mock).to receive(:order).with(:id).and_return(sleep_logs_relation_mock)
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            
              10
            

            

                allow(sleep_logs_relation_mock).to receive(:find_in_batches).and_yield([]) # Default to yielding an empty array
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            

            

              end
          
      39.

              10
            

            

                Timecop.return # Unfreeze time after each test.
          
      42.

      43.

              1
            

            

              describe '#perform' do
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            
              1
            

            

                context 'when the user follows the followed_user' do
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            

            

                  # Let's define some sample sleep logs for the followed_user.
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            
              6
            

            

                  let!(:finished_log_1) { create(:sleep_log, user: followed_user, clock_in: frozen_time - 2.days, clock_out: frozen_time - 1.day, id: 101) } # Within threshold, finished
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            
              6
            

            

                  let!(:finished_log_2_old) { create(:sleep_log, user: followed_user, clock_in: frozen_time - 8.days, clock_out: frozen_time - 7.days - 1.hour, id: 102) } # Outside threshold, finished
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            
              6
            

            

                  let!(:pending_log) { create(:sleep_log, user: followed_user, clock_in: frozen_time - 3.days, clock_out: nil, id: 103) } # Within threshold, not finished
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            
              6
            

            

                  let!(:finished_log_3) { create(:sleep_log, user: followed_user, clock_in: frozen_time - 4.days, clock_out: frozen_time - 3.days, id: 104) } # Within threshold, finished
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            

            

            
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            
              1
            

            

                  before do
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            

            

                    # Configure `find_in_batches` to yield batches of our test logs.
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            

            

                    # Ensure logs are yielded in the order they would be fetched (by ID).
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            
              5
            

            

                    allow(followed_user.sleep_logs).to receive(:find_in_batches) do |&block|
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            

            

                      # Filter logs by clock_in > leaderboard_threshold_time before yielding.
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            

            

                      # The mock relation already handles `where` and `order`, so here we just simulate yielding.
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            
              5
            

            

                      relevant_logs = [ finished_log_1, finished_log_2_old, pending_log, finished_log_3 ].select do |log|
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            
              20
            

            

                        log.clock_in > leaderboard_threshold_time
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            

            

                      end.sort_by(&:id) # Sort by ID as per `order(:id)`
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            

            

            
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            

            

                      # Yield in batches (e.g., in a single batch for simplicity here)
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
              5
            

            

                      block.call(relevant_logs)
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            

            

                    end
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            

            

                  end
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            

            

            
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            
              1
            

            

                  it 'iterates through relevant sleep logs of the followed user' do
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            
              1
            

            

                    service.perform
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            

            

                    # Verify that `where` and `order` were called on the relation.
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            
              1
            

            

                    expect(followed_user.sleep_logs).to have_received(:where).with("clock_in > ?", leaderboard_threshold_time)
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            
              1
            

            

                    expect(followed_user.sleep_logs).to have_received(:order).with(:id)
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            

            

                    # Verify that `find_in_batches` was called.
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            
              1
            

            

                    expect(followed_user.sleep_logs).to have_received(:find_in_batches)
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            

            

                  end

    spec/services/leaderboard_service/precomputed_feed_spec.rb

    100.0% lines covered

    1. 
            
              1
            

            

            require 'rails_helper'
          
      2. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    2. 
            
              1
            

            

            require 'timecop' # For controlling time in tests
          
      3. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    3. 
            

            

            
          
      4. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    4. 
            
              1
            

            

            RSpec.describe LeaderboardService::PrecomputedFeed, type: :service do
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            
              13
            

            

              let!(:user) { create(:user) }
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            
              13
            

            

              let(:frozen_time) { Time.zone.parse("2024-06-25 10:00:00 UTC") }
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            
              11
            

            

              let(:options) { {} }

                context 'when fetch_multi returns logs not in order' do

                  before do
          
      185.

                    # The service sorts them after fetching, so this should still produce the correct sorted output.
          
      186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    186. 
            
              1
            

            

                    allow(SleepLog).to receive(:fetch_multi).with([ valid_sleep_log_1.id, valid_sleep_log_2.id ], includes: :user)

      192.

                  context 'when clock_in time overlaps with an existing sleep log' do
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            

            

                    # Test scenarios for overlapping:
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            

            

                    # Existing: [-----]
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            

            

                    # New:      [--] (new inside existing)
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            

            

                    # New:    [-------] (existing inside new)
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            

            

                    # New: [----] (partial overlap at start)
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            

            

                    # New:    [----] (partial overlap at end)
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            
              1
            

            

                    let!(:existing_sleep_log) do
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            
              8
            

            

                      create(:sleep_log, user: user,
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            

            

                             clock_in: frozen_time - 10.hours, # 00:00:00 UTC
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            

            

                             clock_out: frozen_time - 5.hours) # 05:00:00 UTC
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            

            

                    end

              1

              2
            

            

                        expect { service.perform }.to raise_error(SleepLogService::Error, "Clock in time is overlapped with existing sleep log")

                        # This should still raise if the query is `clock_in <= new_clock_in AND clock_out >= new_clock_in`

    207. 
            

            

                        # which it is.
          
      208. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    208. 
            
              2

    209. 
            

            

                      end
          
      210.

      221. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    221. 
            
              2
            

            

                        expect { service.perform }.to raise_error(SleepLogService::Error, "Clock in time is overlapped with existing sleep log")
          
      222. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    222. 
            

            

                      end
          
      223. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    223.

    240.

                    end

              1

      244. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    244. 
            
              2
            

            

                      expect { service.perform }.to raise_error(SleepLogService::Error, /Clock in must be lower than/)
          
      245. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    245. 
            

            

                    end
          
      246. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    246. 
            

            

            
          
      247. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    247. 
            
              1
            

            

                    it 'does not create a new sleep log' do
          
      248. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    248. 
            
              2

      249. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    249.

                    end
          
      255. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    255. 
            

            

                  end
          
      256.

                      service.perform rescue nil

      280. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    280. 
            
              1
            

            

                context 'when a database transaction error occurs' do
          
      281. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    281. 
            
              1
            

            

                  let(:params) do
          
      282. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    282. 
            

            

                    {
          
      283. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    283. 
            
              1
            

            

                      clock_in: frozen_time - 3.hours,
          
      284. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    284. 
            

            

                      clock_out: frozen_time - 1.hour
          
      285. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    285. 
            

            

                    }
          
      286. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    286. 
            

            

                  end
          
      287. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    287. 
            

            

            
          
      288. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    288. 
            
              1
            

            

                  it 'rolls back all changes and does not produce event' do
          
      289. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    289. 
            
              1
            

            

                    allow_any_instance_of(SleepLog).to receive(:save!).and_raise(StandardError, "Simulated transaction failure")
          
      290. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    290. 
            
              2
            

            

                    expect { service.perform }.to raise_error(StandardError, "Simulated transaction failure")
          
      291. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    291. 
            

            

            
          
      292. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    292. 
            
              1
            

            

                    expect_any_instance_of(SleepLog).not_to receive(:save!) # No new log should be created
          
      293. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    293. 
            
              1
            

            

                    expect(Racecar).not_to have_received(:produce_sync) # No event should be published
          
      294. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    294. 
            

            

                  end
          
      295. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    295. 
            

            

                end
          
      296. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    296. 
            

            

              end
          
      297. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    297. 
            

            

            end
          
      298.
